title: Regression Computer Output
question_text:
Suppose bivariate data was collected on NFL quarterbacksâ€™ fantasy football points during the current year ($Y$) compared to the fantasy points of the year before ($X$).
Twenty quarterbacks were selected for this data. Summary data is as follows for the linear equation $y = a+bx$.
$b = 0.6776$
$a = 0.2305$
${ SE }_{ b }= 0.08807$*
A $99\%$ linear regression $T$-interval

choices.text:
Captures
1
, which fails to give evidence of any positive correlation between current year and previous year fantasy points.

Does not capture
0
, failing to give evidence of a positive linear relationship.

Does not capture
1
, failing to give evidence of any positive linear correlation between current year and previous year fantasy points.

Captures
0
, failing to give evidence of a positive linear relationship.

Is entirely above
0
, giving evidence of a positive linear relationship.
